label: ham
subject:
Rev 145: bit less verbose when client exits in
	http://samba.org/~tridge/ctdb
body: 8 (return) [ Britannia fertilis provincia tyrannorum, is a memorable expression, used by Jerom in the Pelagian controversy, and variously tortured in the disputes of our national antiquaries. The revolutions of the last age appeared to justify the image of the sublime Bossuet, “sette ile, plus orageuse que les mers qui l’environment.”]
